page.title: 13BRAYDON EDUCATION
page.content: The children in this remote area use the same school system as other children. The journey to school, though, takes various forms. The only child attending school from this area is transported to the Primary School by taxi. The cost is borne by the Education Authority. If possible, though, children generally use the School Coach which picks them up at a convenient point and returns at the end of the school day.Alternatively, a parent transports children in their own private cars. Having attended the Village Primary/Junior School until the age of 11 years they then go to the Comprehensive School in the local town. Some wealthier parents choose private education for their children and in these instances they stay at a boarding school.
